cellar, cave, hole in the ground
hurriedly, in a hurry, in great haste
warehouse style, house built like a kura, with the walls covered in mud

releasing stored goods (esp. sake), delivery (of goods from a storehouse)
hurried, hasty, busy, precipitate, sudden, abrupt
godown within a compound, warehouse within a building complex
in great haste, hurriedly, in a hurry
ancient architectural style using interlocked triangular logs
sweet adzuki bean paste made of a mixture of mashed and whole beans

sense.gloss: Ogura Hyakunin Isshu, classical Japanese anthology of one hundred Japanese waka by one hundred poets

r_ele.r: かまくらしんぶっきょう

sense.gloss: new schools of Japanese Buddhism founded during the Kamakura period
the god of foodstuffs (esp. of rice)
the five great Rinzai temples of Kamakura (Kenchō-ji, Engaku-ji, Jufuku-ji, Jōchi-ji, Jōmyō-ji)
shelving (a play, movie, etc.), closing down, cancelling, canceling, shelf (i.e. "on the shelf")
rice storehouse of the Edo shogunate
case that something major happens, event of an emergency, when it comes to the crunch

sdata.j: ↑鎌倉↑↓かまくら↓は↑源氏↑↓げんじ↓ゆかりの↑地↑↓ち↓です。
sdata.e: Kamakura is a place noted in connection with the Genji family.

sdata.j: ↑鎌倉↑↓かまくら↓に↑住↑↓す↓んで↑１↑↓じゅう↓↑２↑↓に↓↑年↑↓ねん↓になる。
sdata.e: I have lived in Kamakura for twelve years.

sdata.j: ↑何↑↓なに↓しろ↑小↑↓ちい↓さい↑店↑↓みせ↓なので、↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑会計↑↓かいけい↓↑係↑↓がかり↓から↑倉庫↑↓そうこ↓↑係↑↓がかり↓まで↑多↑↓おお↓くの↑仕事↑↓しごと↓を↑一手↑↓いって↓にこなさなければならない。
sdata.e: Because the store is so small, he has to wear many different hats, from accountant to stock boy.

sdata.j: どの↑電車↑↓でんしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓れば↑鎌倉↑↓かまくら↓に↑行↑↓い↓きますか。
sdata.e: Which train takes us to Kamakura?

sdata.j: その↑倉庫↑↓そうこ↓は↑麻薬↑↓まやく↓↑密売↑↓みつばい↓↑者↑↓しゃ↓の↑隠↑↓かく↓れみのだった。
sdata.e: The warehouse was a front for drug traffickers.

sdata.j: ↑高倉↑↓たかくら↓さんから↑電話↑↓でんわ↓があったわよ。
sdata.e: You had a phone call from Mr Takakura.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓↑達↑↓たち↓は、↑新大阪↑↓しんおおさか↓ホテルへ↑寄↑↓よ↓って、↑高倉↑↓たかくら↓さんをお↑連↑↓つ↓れしましょう。
sdata.e: We'll stop at the New Osaka Hotel and pick up Mr Takakura.

sdata.j: ↑車↑↓くるま↓を↑倉庫↑↓そうこ↓に↑入↑↓い↓れなさい。
sdata.e: Put the car into the garage.

sdata.j: ↑倉庫↑↓そうこ↓には↑家具↑↓かぐ↓が↑一↑↓ひと↓つの↑他↑↓ほか↓には↑何↑↓なに↓もなかった。
sdata.e: The warehouse was empty except for a piece of furniture.

sdata.j: ↑倉庫↑↓そうこ↓の↑鍵↑↓かぎ↓を↑掛↑↓か↓け↑忘↑↓わす↓れたのは、いったい↑誰↑↓だれ↓ですか？
sdata.e: Who was it that forgot to lock the door of the warehouse?

sdata.e: Mr Miyake showed me lots of places during my stay in Kurashiki.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑名前↑↓なまえ↓は↑小倉↑↓おぐら↓↑知之↑↓ともゆき↓です。
sdata.e: His name is Tomoyuki Ogura.

sdata.e: She's leading a happy life with her husband near the sea in Kamakura.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓↑達↑↓たち↓は、↑新大阪↑↓しんおおさか↓ホテルへ↑寄↑↓よ↓って、↑高倉↑↓たかくら↓さんをお↑連↑↓つ↓れしましょう。

sdata.j: ↑高倉↑↓たかくら↓↑謙↑↓けん↓は↑新↑↓あたら↓しい↑仕事↑↓しごと↓になれてなかった。

sdata.j: ↑高倉↑↓たかくら↓さんから↑電話↑↓でんわ↓があったわよ。
sdata.e: You had a phone call from Mr. Takakura.

sdata.j: ↑佐倉↑↓さくら↓さんの↑新↑↓あら↓たな↑一↑↓いち↓↑面↑↓めん↓が↑見↑↓み↓れるかもしれない。
